summary: Erynduin Cottage is yet another humble player home in Riverwood built specifically for elven folk.
descriptionHtml:
[b][color=#79ce14]Erynduin Cottage[/color][/b] is a humble player home for elven folk. It is located at the pine forest beside Riverwood not far from where Faendal goes to hunt in the wee hours of the morning.

The property is not linked to any quests. Just travel to it and it’s yours. I use it as a marital home for my wood elf character and I like to pretend that she and her husband had built it.

* * * [color=#f49083]This is my first mod.[/color] I hope you like it. :*) 

[b][color=#79ce14]FEATURES[/color][/b]

- Visible on the world map
- Horse goes to the stable when arriving via fast travel
- Containers are safe for storage
- Bed gives the Well Rested bonus (if unmarried)
- Able to get the Lover’s Comfort Bonus (if married)
- Your spouse or follower is able to sleep on bed, tend to the garden, and use the crafting objects outside if used with the MHYH mod
- Follower friendly
- Plants respawn 10 days after leaving the cell

[b]What’s outside?[/b]

- stable for one horse
- wood chop block
- basic smithy (anvil, workbench, grindstone)
- cabbages, leeks, potatoes, and gourds you can harvest
- tundra cotton and red mountain flowers on the roof you can harvest 
  (Only the player and horse can go to the roof at the moment. You can access it through the ladder at the back.)
- campfire

[b]What’s inside?[/b]

- fireplace with cooking spit
- small dining area with shelves and cupboards for storage
- 2 upper bookshelves
- 1 weapon rack with shield
- 2 additional weapon racks
- 1 dagger display case
- 1 double bed
- 2 wardrobes
- writing desk
- enchanting and alchemy room
- wall shelves for potions
- 2 chests

[b][color=#79ce14]Installing and Uninstalling[/color][/b]

[u]To install[/u], simply unzip the contents of ErynduinCottage.zip to your Skyrim Data Folder.

[u]To uninstall[/u]:

Retrieve all items stored in the house. If there are NPCs living in it, make them go back to their original homes. 
Make a new gamesave then quit before manually deleting the mod files from the Data Folder.

[color=#79ce14]Credits[/color]
Many thanks to [color=#f4f083]Blary[/color] for [b]OpenBooks Resource[/b] and [b]FoodContainers Resource[/b]
author: Browless of BattlesEnd
